meanings.definition: In an atomistic manner; with a focus on individual atoms.
meanings.sent1: She studied the structure of the material atomistically, examining each tiny particle closely.
meanings.sent2: The scientist observed the chemical reaction atomistically, observing the behavior of individual atoms.
meanings.sent3: The curious child tried to understand the concept of atoms atomistically, imagining them as tiny building blocks.
meanings.sent4: The artist painted the intricate details of the flower atomistically, capturing each petal with precision.
meanings.sent5: The detective analyzed the evidence atomistically, looking for clues at a microscopic level.

meanings.definition: Characterized by a belief in the theory that the universe is composed of indivisible particles.
meanings.sent1: The professor's atomistically inclined mind led him to explore the smallest components of matter.
meanings.sent2: Her atomistically inspired research focused on the fundamental building blocks of nature.
meanings.sent3: The atomistically minded philosopher pondered the idea of a universe made up of tiny, unbreakable units.
meanings.sent4: The artist's atomistically themed painting depicted a world where everything was composed of indivisible particles.
meanings.sent5: The scientist's atomistically driven theory proposed that the universe is a collection of tiny, unchangeable elements.
